definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
A famous teacher trains a fine student (idiom). A cultured man will have a deep influence on his successors.

sentences.english: Not very young, the hope that they can learn more teachers, more personal style.
sentences.chinese: 不太年轻时候，希望自己能多学名师，多些个人风格。

sentences.english: Students can get a lot from a video of a lecture given by a great teacher.
sentences.chinese: 通过名师的授课视频，学生们着实收获良多。

sentences.english: The paintings by masters from abroad blows my mind.
sentences.chinese: 国外的名师作品让我眼前一亮。

sentences.english: The income of the world famous teacher dwindled down to almost nothing.
sentences.chinese: 这位名师的收入也减少到几近于零。

sentences.english: He is a Chinese medical practitioner with 70 years of working experiences.
sentences.chinese: 民间草医，年青时拜许多名师，行医70多年。

sentences.english: People all say "The famous master has no greats students", I only disagree.
sentences.chinese: 人们都说“名师出高徒”，我独不以为然。

sentences.english: The man who lives next door is a famous teacher.
sentences.chinese: 住在隔壁的那个人是个名师。

sentences.english: How to cultivate famous teachers and headmasters has become a great task in the new period.
sentences.chinese: 如何培养名师名校长便成为新时期一个重大的课题。

sentences.english: The famous teacher, appntice, good teachers course will teach the students.
sentences.chinese: 所为名师出高徒，好教师当然会教出好学生。

sentences.english: The fourth section is to explore the factors affecting the development of Master Teacher of SVE.
sentences.chinese: 第四章是对中职教学名师专业发展影响因素的探究。

sentences.english: The famous teachers are universally-accepted good teachers.
sentences.chinese: 名师就是大家公认的好教师。

sentences.english: Moreover the potential aptitude of Zhang Jiahuan gained the praise of many famous teachers.
sentences.chinese: 而张佳欢的潜质也得到了不少名师的赞赏。

sentences.english: He spent his time in teaching and became a famous teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他把时间都投入到教学中，成了一位名师。

sentences.english: The growth of famous teachers needs certain inherent conditions and outside conditions.
sentences.chinese: 名师的成长需要具备一定的内在条件和外在条件。

sentences.english: You are unsung heroes, is the world famous.
sentences.chinese: 您是无名英雄，又是教坛名师。

sentences.english: Won 12 research achievement awards of various levels and Wu Jieping Medical Research Awards.
sentences.chinese: 获各级成果12项，并获“国家名师”荣誉称号。

definition: renowned expert/master (of an art or craft)
School of Logicians of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC), also called the School of Names
to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
A famous teacher trains a fine student (idiom). A cultured man will have a deep influence on his successors.
(idiom) to teach in line with the student's ability
to teach face to face/to instruct in person
to give classes/to work as a teacher
